comments:
Hi,

I have Eclipse 3.1.2 installed (Debian ppc), I try to install WTP with site update, but some jars don't want to download. The ErrorLog View tells me there is a '403 Forbidden' problem and of course, when using a mirror, I got a '404 NotFound'.

I can help if you need more informations,

Thanks for your time,

PS: I set the severity to major because I think it's still possible to use WTP if downloaded, but it's not possible for me with site update.

Here is the location I can't update:

Error retrieving "plugins/org.eclipse.wst.css.core_1.0.0.v200602062135.jar". [Server returned HTTP response code: "403 Forbidden" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/updates/plugins/org.eclipse.wst.css.core_1.0.0.v200602062135.jar.]

Another location I couldn't retrieve is:
Error retrieving "plugins/org.eclipse.emf.ecore.editor_2.1.0.jar". [Server returned HTTP response code: "403 Forbidden" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/plugins/org.eclipse.emf.ecore.editor_2.1.0.jar.]

The strange thing is when I try it from FireFox, it seems to work...

Here is the stack trace:
java.io.IOException: Server returned HTTP response code: "403 Forbidden" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/plugins/org.eclipse.emf.ecore.editor_2.1.0.jar.
	at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.UpdateManagerUtils.checkConnectionResult(UpdateManagerUtils.java:524)
	at org.eclipse.update.core.ContentReference.getInputSize(ContentReference.java:193)
	at org.eclipse.update.core.FeatureContentProvider.asLocalReference(FeatureContentProvider.java:214)
	at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.FeaturePackagedContentProvider.getPluginEntryArchiveReferences(FeaturePackagedContentProvider.java:165)
	at org.eclipse.update.internal.operations.UpdateUtils.downloadFeatureContent(UpdateUtils.java:627)
	at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.InstallWizard2.download(InstallWizard2.java:405)
	at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.InstallWizard2.access$3(InstallWizard2.java:394)
	at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.InstallWizard2$4.run(InstallWizard2.java:350)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)


And FYI, I'm using IBM's jdk:
java.fullversion=J2RE 1.4.2 IBM build cxppc32142-20050929 (SR3) (JIT enabled: jitc)

And another location:
Error retrieving "plugins/org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore_2.1.0.jar". [Server returned HTTP response code: "403 Forbidden" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/plugins/org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore_2.1.0.jar.]

And then:
Error retrieving "plugins/org.eclipse.wst.validation_1.0.1.v200602070050.jar". [Server returned HTTP response code: "403 Forbidden" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/updates/plugins/org.eclipse.wst.validation_1.0.1.v200602070050.jar.]

And then:
Error retrieving "plugins/org.eclipse.draw2d_3.1.1.jar". [Server returned HTTP response code: "403 Forbidden" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/updates/3.0/plugins/org.eclipse.draw2d_3.1.1.jar.]

And then:
Error retrieving "plugins/org.eclipse.emf_2.1.1.jar". [Server returned HTTP response code: "403 Forbidden" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/tools/emf/updates/plugins/org.eclipse.emf_2.1.1.jar.]

And then:
Unable to access "http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/updates/site.xml".

Stack trace for the latest:

David, I'm moving this to releng. Maybe we need a component for the update manager? In any case, please handle this.

If you are not going through a mirror, I believe these 403 access forbidden repsonses are due to an Eclipse.org infrastructure problem the past few days. So, will try and change to infrastructure component for comments.

I couldn't get WTP from mirror or eclipse site because of 404/403 errors.  Any ideas?

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 8 1 2006-03-09 10:43:26.582
!MESSAGE

Please try again from the main eclipse.org site. There were infrastructure problems at eclipse.org that were causing 403/404 errors. These were fixed between 8-Mar and 9-Mar and the mirrors may not have been updated by 9-Mar.  Please try again and report back. Thank you.

I believe its fair to count this as dup of bug 131025. 
Please re-open (or open new bugs) if you continue to see any problems. 

Thanks for reporting. 


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 131025 ***
